notes:
# **Power**  [Spynstem Update](item_9fbbe756-5dd6-44f6-abd8-a8355f0be2b5) 

## **OR**

##  [Centripetal Charge](item_4c59fa91-c687-4c6d-810d-ddb79288315a) 

Your first two powers for an Ultrisa build should always be spynstem update and centripetal charge. It doesn't matter which one is first, as almost every orisa build tends to come online at round 3. Or at least all of mine do.

In low elo people just don't seem to understand that Spynstem is going to deflect and at higher elo it can be used to be a really oppressive projectile denial, as they'll understand how dangerous it is to let you deflect projectiles, due to how quickly Spynstem builds ult charge - the entire point of this build.

If you start with Spynstem update, however, Your enemies may call it out quickly and not let you get many deflects. If you wait for R3 to get spynstem, and start with centripetal, you can punish the fact that your opponents may be slower to call it out while your build is already online.

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

 ## [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) 

 ## [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) 

 ## [Plasma Converter](item_25869f9a-9a29-4e19-96b6-9d8a28c59318) 

I almost always take Armored vest, Compensator, and plasma converter on every hero build, the extra bulk and weapon power are too strong to pass up, and on tanks I think lifesteal is a bit broken, especially in the early stages.

If you're playing on a longer mode, like Push, (or, I assume, payload race when it's introduced), you're much more likely to get your ult than if you're playing clash, so I would lose either compensator or plasma converter for Power Playbook, since AP is going to be the focus of this build, kind of.

I also find that a lot of people don't seem to check builds in the scoreboard tab, so I wouldn't worry too hard about them calling it out at the start of round 3.

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

## [Junker Whatchamajig](item_b81ebab8-5c85-405a-b28d-2496de33cd9c) 

## [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) 

This is a bit pricey for round two. I wouldn't be surprised if you have to sell some/all of your green items, which is fine.

Junker whatchamajig is top priority, since it lets us get Ult as soon as possible. And, you know, that's kind of the point.

Multi-tool is also much more important than your green items, since We'll want a good balance of both high AP and low CDs. If you find that you aren't having any trouble getting your ult, go for Power playbook over the weapon power greens if you have cash left over.

# **Power**  [Centripetal Charge](item_4c59fa91-c687-4c6d-810d-ddb79288315a) 

## **OR**

 [Spynstem Update](item_9fbbe756-5dd6-44f6-abd8-a8355f0be2b5) 

Just whichever one you didn't take in round 1

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

## [Catalytic Crystal](item_3e3f4f77-cdf8-4dda-a5b0-2fb9390aefc4) 

As mentioned, this is your power spike. Now you'll be getting your ult quickly and it'll be restoring your cooldowns.

 [Catalytic Crystal](item_3e3f4f77-cdf8-4dda-a5b0-2fb9390aefc4)  is one of the strongest items in the game for ult builds, as charging your ult faster is... obviously ideal. And again, AP should also be one of our main foci to give your ult extra oomph, and to charge ult faster with your spin and javs.

Sell greens as needed to get cat. crystal

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

## [Elite Rotator Cuff](item_dfba3349-64b8-4386-8eaf-15bcd1ca6b37) 

Elite rotator cuff extends duration of jav spin. It'll be top priority. Also some nice extra AP

## [Crusader Hydraulics](item_b64cee07-ca32-405d-987e-868b415bbc09)  should give some nice extra bulk, as I'm sure we'll be needing it as the DPS start to scale.

Optionally, you can sell multi-tool for Solar regenergy, since it synergizes extremely well with Crusader hydraulics if you're having trouble stayin' alive (ah- ah- ah- ah- ahhhh)

# **Power**  [Factory Reset](item_d98df807-9dd6-4553-96bb-a1b49a0fe169) 

## **OR**

##  [Lassoed](item_9e7d8d55-ac46-48c5-83a7-ddeb59ab7b58) 

As mentioned, CDR is key for this build to get your jav spins up faster and to just deal more AP damage in general for  [Catalytic Crystal](item_3e3f4f77-cdf8-4dda-a5b0-2fb9390aefc4) , and  [Factory Reset](item_d98df807-9dd6-4553-96bb-a1b49a0fe169)  is more CDR.

I also just really love  [Lassoed](item_9e7d8d55-ac46-48c5-83a7-ddeb59ab7b58) it's really strong and doesn't require much to be a good pivot. I find that  [Factory Reset](item_d98df807-9dd6-4553-96bb-a1b49a0fe169)'s CDR isn't worth not having as much CC as  [Lassoed](item_9e7d8d55-ac46-48c5-83a7-ddeb59ab7b58) but  [Factory Reset](item_d98df807-9dd6-4553-96bb-a1b49a0fe169) is technically more in line with the actual build

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

## [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) 

### [Diviner's Kevlar](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e)- Sorry, I mean  [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) , is one of the most important purple items for this build. 20% AP, 10% CDR, and some nice bulk when you ult make it extremely worth its $11000 price tag, putting it at top priority

If you need the cash,  [Crusader Hydraulics](item_b64cee07-ca32-405d-987e-868b415bbc09)  and/or [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56)  should be tapering off in effectiveness around now (Or  [Solar Regenergy](item_b03b2c68-d3e3-413a-a9b8-3385149ba9b8) as well if you took it last round)

If you've got cash to spare, and selling Crusader hydraulics or multi-tool or both will get you there, and you need more bulk,  [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d)  is one of the best survival items in the game

round_upgrades.notes:
extremely cancer to face if you don't have anti-CC

Your build is already going to naturally support LassoJav with its high CDR, and there honestly isn't a lot people can do to counter Lassorisa.
As mentioned, CDR is key for this build to get your jav spins up faster and to just deal more AP damage in general for Cat. Crystal, and factory reset is more CDR.

notes:
# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

Alright, we've got a lot of branching paths here. The build was pretty much complete by round 4, and round 5 was pretty much just micro adjustments, so a lot of these items will be dealer's choice. I'll rank the items here, but know that they're pretty much interchangeable, and that you should use the ones you like.

 ## [3D-Printed Lance](item_b11e8cd7-9755-44bd-8857-f19457f6f1cf) : If you took Lassoed  over Factory reset, this item is pretty much a must. More javs = more cancer

##  [Vanadium Injection](item_57953fbc-11ff-4e92-9928-fc59b7be668f) : Need I say more? It's an ult build, and this rewards us for having ult. Also works well with the lasso build, since you'll want to build jav spam, and this further decreases CD and increases AP

##  [Liquid Nitrogen](item_a8d99526-05a3-4405-babb-b025479b1b98) : Stops enemies from escaping your ult. It's a no brainer. Take this especially if they lack movement, or if they have too much movement, I guess. This will confirm kills with the former, and make you much more threatening to the latter.

## [Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505) : AP, CDR, you know the drill. Take this if they have too much healing. Especially effective against junker queens for obvious reasons

##  [Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be) : More bulk. Goated item in general. A little out of place on this build, but sometimes the enemy team just has that much CC

you need to sell at least one item to get your purple, obviously. I'd go with  [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56), as its effectiveness just won't be scaling as well as Junker Watchamajig or crusader hydraulics.

If you have the cash for another purple, somehow, I'd sell  [Crusader Hydraulics](item_b64cee07-ca32-405d-987e-868b415bbc09)  next.

notes:
# **Power**  [Restortify](item_e5073fbb-8287-4d11-934a-1fc1c57a308b) 

## **OR**

##  [Advanced Throwbotics](item_20ae3070-5e6b-4352-b024-95b426055ee0) 

 [Restortify](item_e5073fbb-8287-4d11-934a-1fc1c57a308b) is fantastic for bulk. Take  [Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be) with this.

 [Advanced Throwbotics](item_20ae3070-5e6b-4352-b024-95b426055ee0) just doubles the amount of lassojavs you have

# -----------------------------------

# **Items**

This is just an advanced round 6. I won't be repeating the reasons to take the ones that were already present, but I'll still mention them if I feel they take priority

Sell your blues to make cash for as many purples as you can. If you must take a blue, take  [Junker Whatchamajig](item_b81ebab8-5c85-405a-b28d-2496de33cd9c) .

## [3D-Printed Lance](item_b11e8cd7-9755-44bd-8857-f19457f6f1cf) 

## [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) : One of my favorite survival items. Synergizes incredibly well with restortify

## [Liquid Nitrogen](item_a8d99526-05a3-4405-babb-b025479b1b98) 

## [Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) : If you aren't using the Lassoed build, you'll be relying on your gun to fill the times that your CDs are off. If you are, this is also pretty much a must, since you will want to actually punish the enemies you've displaced, and your skills will be on cooldown

## [Vanadium Injection](item_57953fbc-11ff-4e92-9928-fc59b7be668f) 

## [Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505) 

## [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) : This item sucks. It is one of the least cost-efficient items in the game. The only reason you should ever buy it is if you're in the lategame and you want a big AP boost. This is one of those times.

## [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d) 

## [Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be)
